comments.body: are this invented numbers? Otherwise it's 0.3.0 I think.
This was copy-pasted from the  scalameta repo and adjusted, I kept the v3.3.0 example but reformulated so it makes sense here.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +16,20 @@  - Close the milestone or milestones corresponding to the release. For example,
    for a v3.3.0 release, we close both 3.3.0 and 3.2.1 (because we never
    released 3.2.1, so all its tickets went straight to 3.3.0).
  - Create the milestone or milestones corresponding to future releases. For
    example, for a v3.3.0 release, we create both v3.3.1 and v3.4.0.
